title: OIDC: List of JWKS is not checked without specified kid
body:
### Describe the bug

I want to protect my resource with the `@Authenticated` annotation and have an oidc `quarkus.oidc.auth-server-url` defined.
From the `jwks_uri` endpoint I have these keys:

``` JSON
{
    "keys": [
        {
            "n": "value for n",
            "e": "AQAB",
            "kty": "RSA",
            "kid": "fQ-Uyjg7QvTpf_mn9yKXmeYPsPE",
            "x5t": "fQ-Uyjg7QvTpf_mn9yKXmeYPsPE",
            "use": "sig"
        },
        {
            "n": "value for n",
            "e": "AQAB",
            "kty": "RSA",
            "kid": "sgw",
            "x5t": "sgw",
            "use": "sig"
        },
        {
            "n": "value for n",
            "e": "AQAB",
            "kty": "RSA",
            "kid": "msgw",
            "x5t": "msgw",
            "use": "sig"
        }
    ]
}
```

My JWS looks like this:

``` JSON
{
    "alg": "RS256"
}
{
    "iss": "https://example.domain.com/openid",
    "sub": "",
    "exp": 1721139705,
    "nbf": 1721138805,
    "iat": 1721138805,
    "jti": "d9e88d72-78fe-430f-8ff3-391161622986",
    "aud": "1234423458943498493883498432348293"
}
<signature>
```

Not completely sure, whether this is a but or intended behaviour, but regarding the [JWS documentation](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7515#appendix-D) multiple keys could be used to verify the signature.

The "issue" seems to be, that the keys are not checked for best effort, but Quarkus is rather looking for a matching kid or falls back to `keyWithoutKeyIdAndThumbprint` (OidcProvider.java:480), which is empty, because all keys have an id set.

Would it make sense, to take all available keys into account before OidcProvider.java:492 to have another fallback for verifying the signature?


### Expected behavior

The JWS is correctly verified with one of the provided keys.

### Actual behavior

No key is selected for verification, therefore failing with this message (decoded token content can be seen above):

```
Unable to process JOSE object (cause: org.jose4j.lang.UnresolvableKeyException: JWK is not available, neither 'kid' nor 'x5t#S256' nor 'x5t' token headers are set): JsonWebSignature{"alg":"RS256"}->{token content}
```

### How to Reproduce?

1. Have multiple JWKS keys all with a `kid`
2. Don't specify `kid` in the JWS
3. JWS verification will fail, because no key will be selected for verification
